learningOutcomes.fi: Opiskelija tuntee tieteellisen ajattelun, luovan ongelmanratkaisun ja insinööritieteiden ominaispiirteet. Hän osaa formuloida yksinkertaisia hypoteeseja ja suunnitella tieteellisiä kokeita niiden todentamiseksi ja osaa raportoida tutkimuksensa tuloksia. Opiskelija osaa tehdä ja laskea tarvittavia approksimaatioita ja arvioida suuruusluokkia ja ymmärtää numeeriseen dataan liittyviä epävarmuustekijöitä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Den studerande vet grunderna i vetenskapligt tänkande, känner till kreativ problemlösning och ingenjörsvetenskapens karaktär. Hen kan formulera enkla hypoteser och planera vetenskapliga experiment för att autentisera resultat och vet hur man rapporterar sina forskningsresultat. Studeranden kan göra och beräkna approksimationer och evaluera storleksklasser och förstår betänkligheter i numersisk data.
learningOutcomes.en: Student understands the basics of scientific and critical thinking, engineering design, and creative problem-solving. Student can formulate simple hypotheses and design and carry out simple scientific experiments. Student can solve engineering design problems and exercise engineering judgement. Student is able to make approximations and estimate order of magnitudes (i.e. ballpark figures), and understands sources of error in seemingly objective numerical data.

content.fi: Kurssilla käsitellään luonnontieteiden, ihmistieteiden ja insinööritieteiden perusteita. Käsiteltäviä aihieta ovat mallit ja teoriat, kokeellinen tutkimus, havainnointi, simulointi, tilastollinen tutkimus. Kurssin aikana toteutetaan pieniä tieteellisiä kokeita ja suunnittelutehtäviä yksin ja ryhmissä. Kurssilla opitaan luovan ja kriittisen ajattelun perusteita itse tekemällä ja osallistumalla. Aiheina mm. tiedonhaku, päätöksenteko, raha, todennäköisyys ja riski, approksimaatiot ja suuruusluokka-arviot, mittaukset ja virhearviot.
content.sv: Kursen täcker grundläggande idéer i naturvetenskap, humaniora och teknik. Vi kommer att diskutera teorier och modeller, experimentell forskning, observation, simulering och statistisk forskning. Under kursen implementeras små vetenskapliga experiment och designuppgifter ensam och i grupp. Studerande lär sig kreativt och kritiskt tänkande genom att göra och delta. Exempel på ämnen: Informationssökning, beslutsfattande, pengar, sannolikhet och risk, approximationer och storleksbetyg, mätningar och fel.
content.en: The course covers basic ideas in sciences, humanities and engineering. We will discuss theories and models, experimental research, observation, simulation, and statistical research. During the course, small scientific experiments and design tasks are implemented alone and in groups. The students learn creative and critical thinking by doing and participating. Topics include information retrieval, decision-making, money, probability and risk, approximations and order of magnitude estimates, measurements and errors.

assesmentMethods.fi: Viikottainen integroitu luento- ja tehtäväsessio, jossa käydään läpi kotitehtäviä, opetellaan uutta asiaa ja tehdään paikan päällä harjoituksia yksilöllisesti ja ryhmissä. Käytännössä pakollinen läsnäolo. Riittävä pistemäärä palautetuista kotitehtävistä ja ryhmätöistä. Ei tenttiä.
assesmentMethods.sv: Integrerad föreläsnings- och uppgiftssession veckosvis, där man går igenom hemuppgifter, lär sig nya saker och gör övningar på plats, individuellt och i grupp. Praktiskt taget obligatorisk närvaro. Tillräcklig poängsumma av de inlämnade hemuppgifterna och grupparbeten. Ingen tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: There is a weekly contact session (involving both lectures and exercises) during which new topics are learnt, homeworks are presented and activating exercises/problems are solved, both in groups and individually. Practically compulsory presence. To pass the course, student has to obtain enough points from homeworks and group activities. There is no exam in this course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
  • tietää minkälaisista osista kemian tekniikan kandidaatin tutkinto koostuu.
  • tietää mistä opintoasioihin voi kysyä neuvoa ja millaisia opiskeluhyvinvoinnin palveluita on tarjolla.
  • osaa tehdä oman opintosuunnitelman ja päivittää sitä tarpeen mukaan.
  • osaa käyttää opintoihin liittyviä tietojärjestelmiä.
  • osaa käyttää ajanhallinnan työkaluja oman ajankäytön suunnittelemiseen.
  • osaa antaa palautetta opetukseen ja opiskeluympäristöön liittyvistä asioista.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter avlagd kurs vet studeranden
  • hur kandidatexamen är uppbyggd och vilka delar den består av.
  • vem man kontaktar vid olika slags frågor och hurdant stöd det erbjuds.
  • hur hen lägger upp en studieplan och kan uppdatera den vid behov.
  • hur hen använder olika program och system som har med studierna att göra.
  • hur hen planerar sin egen tidsanvändning och kan använda verktyg som stöd för detta.
  • hur hen kan ge åtekoppling på undervisning och studiemiljö.

name.en: Laboratory Work in Organic Chemistry, Lecture

workload.fi:
2 op = 54 h
Lähiopetus: laboratoriotyöskentely (18 h)
Itsenäinen opiskelu: ennakkotehtävät, laboratoriotyöskentelyyn liittyvät tehtävät, tulosten raportointi (36 h)
workload.sv:
2 op = 54 h
Kontaktundervisning: laboratoriearbete (18 h)
Eget arbete: förhandsuppgifter, uppgifter relaterade till laboratoriearbete, rapportering av resultater (36 h)
workload.en:
2 ECTS = 54 hr
In-person teaching: laboratory work (18 hr)
Independent work: pre-assignments, assignments related to laboratory work, reporting the results (36 hr)

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140 on oltava suoritettuna ennen laboratoriotöiden aloittamista.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: För deltagande i laborationerna krävs godkänd kurs i laborationssäkerhet: CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Laboratoriokurssilla suoritetaan orgaaniseen kemiaan liittyviä harjoitustöitä. Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija:
  • pystyy tekemään yksinkertaisen synteesin annetun ohjeen perusteella
  • osaa kirjoittaa kaarinuolimekanismin yksinkertaiselle reaktiolle
  • osaa pitää laboratoriopäiväkirjaa
  • osaa työskennellä turvallisesti orgaanisen kemian laboratoriossa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Under kursen utförs arbeten inom organisk kemi. Efter kursen kan studeranden:
  • utföra en enkel syntes enligt given instruktion
  • kan skriva "curved arrow" mekanismen för en enkel reaktion
  • kan hålla laboratoriebok för syntesarbeten
  • kan arbeta säkert vid organisk kemi laboratorium
learningOutcomes.en:
In the laboratory course, practical exercises related to organic chemistry are performed. After completing the course, the student:
  • can perform a simple synthesis according to the provided procedure
  • can write a curved arrow reaction mechanism for a simple reaction
  • can write laboratory journal
  • work safely in organic chemistry laboratory

content.fi: Opintojaksolla opitaan hyödyntämään ohutlevykromatografiaa (TLC) orgaanisten synteesien seurantaan. Opinjakso sisältää kaksi synteesiä, joiden tuotteet analysoidaan kromatograafisesti ja/tai IR-spektroskopian avulla.
content.sv: Under kursen utförs tunnskiktskromatografiska separeringar (TLC) för att följa organiska reaktioner. I laboratoriet görs två synteser vilka följs med kromatografiska metoder samt/eller IR spektroskopi.
content.en: The course covers the utilization of thin-layer chromatography (TLC) for monitoring organic reactions. The module includes two syntheses, and the synthesisproducts are analyzed by chromatographic methods and/or by infrared spectroscopy.

assesmentMethods.fi: Laboratoriotyöskentely, raportit ja kotitehtävät
assesmentMethods.sv: Laboratoriearbete, rapporter och hemuppgifter
assesmentMethods.en: Laboratory work, reports and homework

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the course the student will be able to:
- Name basic structures of cells (plant, microbe, animal)
- Present examples of the structure and function of amino acids and proteins in cells
- Describe at a general level the function of enzymes and the basics of enzyme kinetics
- Present selected cell energy metabolism and principal metabolic routes
- Explain the central dogma of molecular biology
- Describe how DNA is replicated 
- Describe how DNA is transcribed, and translated to proteins 
- Exlpain how genes are regulated, using the lac operon as an example 
- Explain how important techniques in molecular biology work (e.g. PCR and dideoxy sequencing) 
- Explain how heterologous expression of genes is carried out 
- Name different types of viruses and broadly explain how they replicate

content.fi:

     Biomolecules (carbohydrates, amino acids, lipids, nucleic acids)
     Basics of cell energy metabolism
     How genes code for proteins (central dogma of molecular biology, DNA replication, transcription, translation, gene expression, PCR, dideoxy sequncing, heterologous expression, viruses)

The course includes lectures, individual exercises and group work. Students participate in laboratory demonstrations, calculation-assignments, and carry out given assignments independently or in a group. 
Grading is based on group and independent assignments completed during the course (e.g. demonstrations, study groups or online exercises) and course examination. Participation in lab demonstrations is mandatory (see instructions on MyCourses).

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, the student:
- is able to analyze process dynamics derived from physics-based modelling and experimental data
- understands basic process control approaches with a single controlled variable
- understands process dynamics and control also in the Laplace domain
- has knowledge on common instrumentation in the process industries
- understands the stability in both time and in the Laplace domain
- understands how to compensate disturbances
- understands how to implement feedforward, cascade and ratio control

learningOutcomes.fi:
The aim of the course is to give understanding on making process: Process development, Preliminary and Basic design. This course will help you to perform Practical Design Project form industry in Master education as well as skills in process and plant design, hand calculations, Aspen simulation and ability to work in the chemical process industry.  After the course student:
  1. Understands the basics of process development, preliminary and basic design of chemical processes
  2. Can search information for market and carry out feasibility study
  3. Can draw process flow diagrams (PFD), piping and instrumentation (PI) and layout drawings 
  4. Can calculate material and energy balances and use of process simulation tools
  5. Can size the equipment, such as reactors, tanks, pumps, heat exchangers, pipes, control valves and solid handling
  6. Can select the appropriate construction materials
  7. Can understand energy savings and calculate heat integration by using pinch technology
  8. Can calculate process economics
  9. Can apply  environmental, health and safety (EHS) principles in design
learningOutcomes.sv:
The aim of the course is to give understanding on making process: Process development, Preliminary and Basic design. This course will help you to perform Practical Design Project form industry in Master education as well as skills in process and plant design, hand calculations, Aspen simulation and ability to work in the chemical process industry.  After the course student:
  1. Understands the basics of process development, preliminary and basic design of chemical processes
  2. Can search information for market and carry out feasibility study
  3. Can draw process flow diagrams (PFD), piping and instrumentation (PI) and layout drawings 
  4. Can calculate material and energy balances and use of process simulation tools
  5. Can size the equipment, such as reactors, tanks, pumps, heat exchangers, pipes, control valves and solid handling
  6. Can select the appropriate construction materials
  7. Can understand energy savings and calculate heat integration by using pinch technology
  8. Can calculate process economics
  9. Can apply  environmental, health and safety (EHS) principles in design

workload.fi: Luennot 24 hHarjoitukset 48 hKotilaskut 20 hMuu oma opiskelu + tentti 43 h
workload.sv:
Föreläsningar 24
Räkneövningar 48 h
Hemuppgifter 20 h
Annan självstudie + tentamen 43 h
workload.en:
Theory: self study, learning diary 24 h
Exercises 48 h
Home works 20 h
Independent study + exam 43 h

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija: - tuntee yleisimmät erotusoperaatiot ja osaa valita erotusmenetelmän tarpeen perusteella
- osaa tulkita faasitasapainoa kuvaavia diagrammeja sekä valita faasitasapainomalleja ja ratkaista niitä sopivilla ohjelmistoilla
- tuntee prosessisimulaattoreiden toimintaperiaatteen ja osaa ratkaista yksinkertaisten prosessien aineja energiataseita niiden perusteella, asettaa spesifikaatioita ja optimoida prosesseja
- osaa etsiä ja käyttää empiirisiä korrelaatiota aineominaisuuksien ja prosessien malliparametrien estimoimiseen
- ymmärtää kemiallisten teollisten prosessien mekanistisen mallituksen periaatteet ja osaa muodostaa yksinkertaisia prosessimalleja sekä ratkaista niitä
- osaa joidenkin erotusoperaatioiden perusmitoituksen.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen :
- känner studeranden till de vanligaste enhetsoperationerna och kan välja enligt behov den rätta
- kan studeranden tolka fasdiagram som representerar jämvikt mellan olika faser och kan välja och lösa problem med lämpliga simuleringsprogram 
- känner studeranden till funktionsprincipen av process simuleringsprogram och kan lösa  enkla mass- och energibalanser med dem, ställa specifikationer och optimera processer 
- kan studeranden finna och tillämpa empiriska korrelationer för att estimera fysikaliska egenskaper och använda dem som modellparametrar
- förstår studeranden principerna av den mekanistiska modelleringen av industriella processer och kan skapa enkla processmodeller och lösa problem med dem
- kan studeranden grunden av dimensionering av några enhetsoperationer
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student:
- knows the most common unit operations and is able to select proper method based on the need
- is able to interpret phase equilibrium diagrams and is able to choose models to describe the phase equilibrium. Can solve phase equilibria problems with suitable software
- knows the operating principle of process simulators and is able to solve mass and energy balances with these, set specifications and optimize processes
- is able to look for and apply empirical correlations for estimation of physical properties and use these as model parameters in modelling of processes
- understands the mechanistic modelling of industrial chemical processes and is able to form simple process models and solve them
- is able to dimension some unit operations at basic level

content.fi: - Erotusoperaatiot- Mekanistinen kemiallisten prosessien mallitus- Prosessisimulaattoreiden käyttö- Johdanto kemian teollisuuden prosessien ja laitteiden suunnitteluun- Teollisia esimerkkejä
content.sv:
Innehål:
- Enhetsoperationer
- Mekanistisk modellering av kemiska processer
- Användning av process simulationsprogram
- Inledning till planering av industriella processer och apparater
- Industriella exempel
content.en:
Contents:
- Unit operations
- Mechanistic modelling of chemical processes
- The use of process simulators
- Introduction to the design of processes and equipment in chemical industry
- Industrial examples

sekä tentti. Tentti sisältää teoria ja laskuosuuden.

assesmentMethods.en: Theory, learning diary, exercises, two home works in small groups and an exam. Exam includes calculation and theory part.

name.en: Laboratory Work in Organic Synthesis, Lecture

workload.fi: Laboratoriotyöskentelyä
workload.sv: Laboratorie-arbete
workload.en: Laboratory work

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140 on oltava suoritettuna ennen laboratoriotöiden aloittamista. CHEM-A1290 Orgaanisen kemian peruskurssi tai CHEM-A1230 Orgaanisen kemian perusteet suoritettuna. CHEM-A1205 Orgaanisen kemian laboratoriotyöt tai vastaava kurssi toisesta yliopistosta suoritettuna.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: För deltagande i laborationerna krävs godkänd kurs i laborationssäkerhet: CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140. Kursen CHEM-A1290 Grundkurs i organisk kemi eller CHEM-A1230 Grundkurs i organisk kemi bör vara utförd. Kursen CHEM-A1205 Laboratoriearbeten i organisk kemi eller motsvarande laborationskurs i ett annat universitet utförd.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work. The course CHEM-A1290 Fundamentals of Organic Chemistry or CHEM-A1230 Basic Organic Chemistry must be completed. The course CHEM-A1205 Laboratory Work in Organic Chemistry or a corresponding laboratory course at another university must be completed.

learningOutcomes.fi: Orgaanisen synteesin perusteet. Kurssin aikana  suoritetaan 3 - 4 synteesiä. Laboratoriotyöhön valmistaudutaan perehtymällä työohjeeseen ja annettuun lisämateriaaliin. Laboratoriossa työt suoritetaan parityönä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Laboratoriearbeten i organisk syntes. I laboratoriet utförs 3 - 4 synteser. Före arbeten läses instruktionerna och eventuell extra material. Arbeten utförs parvis.
learningOutcomes.en: Laboratorywork in organic synthesis. In the laboratory 3 - 4 syntheses are performed. Before the experimental work, the student studies the intructions and eventual extra material. The experiments are performed in pairs.

content.fi:
Perusreaktioiden (substituutio, eliminaatio ja additio-reaktioiden) ymmärtäminen
Aldoli-reaktio ja aromaattiset substituutio-reaktiot 
Yleisimmät analyysimenetelmät orgaanisille yhdisteille (NMR, IR, MS)
content.sv:
Studier av grundreaktioner inom organisk kemi (substitution, elimination och addition)
Aldol-reaktionen och aromatisk substitution 
Förståelse av de mest använda analysmetoder inom organisk kemi (NMR, IR och MS)
content.en:
Understanding of basic reactions in organic chemistry (substitution, elimination and addition)
Understanding of the Aldol-reaction och aromatic substitution (EAS, NAS)
Introduction to most used analysis-methods used in organic chemistry (NMR, IR och MS)

workload.fi:
5 op = 135 h
Sisältö: Monimuoto-opetus, harjoitukset, laskutuvat, itse- ja vertaisarviointi sekä itsenäinen opiskelu.
workload.sv:
5 sp = 135 h
Innehålla: Flerformsundervisning, övningar, räknestugor,  självständiga studier, själv- och kollegialutvärdering.
workload.en:
5 cr = 135 h
Content: Multiform teaching, exercises, study halls, independent study, peer and self-assessment.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: - CHEM-A1270 Yleinen kemia TAI CHEM-A1200 Kemiallinen rakenne ja sitoutuminen - MS-A0107 Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1 (CHEM) JA MS-A0207 Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2 (CHEM) tai vastaavat kurssit - CHEM-A1025 Fysiikan perusteet kemian tekniikassa TAI PHYS-A2110 Yliopistofysiikan perusteet (CHEM) TAI PHYS-A1130 Sähkömagnetismi (SCI)
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: - CHEM-A1270 Allmän kemi ELLER CHEM-A1200 Kemisk struktur och bindning - MS-A0107 Differential- och integralkalkyl 1 (CHEM) OCH Differential- och integralkalkyl 2 (CHEM) eller motsvarande kurser - CHEM-A1025 Grundläggande fysik inom kemiteknik ELLER PHYS-A2110 Introduktion till universitetsfysik (CHEM) ELLER PHYS-A1130 Elektromagnetism (SCI)
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: - CHEM-A1270 General Chemistry OR CHEM-A1200 Chemical Structure and Bonding - MS-A0107 Differential and Integral Calculus 1 (CHEM) AND Differential and Integral Calculus 2 (CHEM) or corresponding courses - CHEM-A1025 Basic Studies in Physics for Chemical Engineering Students OR PHYS-A2110 Introduction to University Physics (CHEM) OR PHYS-A1130 Electromagnetism (SCI)

learningOutcomes.fi:
Oppimistaitojen osalta opiskelija
  • kehittää ongelmanratkaisutaitojaan ja pystyy ratkaisemaan myös tavallista avoimempia ongelmia.
  • rutinoituu perehtymään kurssimateriaaliin ennen lähiopetusta. Opiskelija oppii tarkkailemaan omaa lukemistaan ja pystyy selittämään mikä luetussa tekstissä on haastavaa.
  • syventää taitojaan kriittisesti arvioida omia ja muiden opiskelijoiden töitä.
Kvanttimekaniikan perusteiden osalta kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
  • tuntee kvanttimekaniikan keskeisimpiä käsitteitä ja ilmiöitä, kuten Schrödingerin yhtälö, aaltofunktio, kvantittuminen, Heisenbergin epätarkkuusperiaate, ja spin sekä osaa soveltaa näitä kvalitatiivisella ja kvantitatiivisella tasolla kemian ongelmiin.
  Atomien ja molekyylien rakenteeseen liittyen opiskelija
  • pystyy käyttämään yksinkertaisia kvanttimekaanisia malleja (esim. hiukkanen laatikossa, harmoninen värähtelijä, pyörimisliike) hiukkasten käyttäytymisen kuvaamiseen ja osaa soveltaa näitä malleja spektroskopisten ilmiöiden tarkastelussa.
  • hahmottaa yksinkertaisimman atomimallin (vetyatomi) välityksellä, miten kvanttimekaniikan periaatteet näkyvät atomien rakenteessa ja jaksollisessa järjestelmässä.
  Spektroskopian alalla opiskelija
  • tuntee eri spektroskopian lajeja ja osaa soveltaa kvanttimekaanista kuvaa atomeista ja molekyyleistä säteilyn ja aineen vuorovaikutuksen kuvaamiseen. Opiskelija pystyy luokittelemaan eri spektroskopialajit vuorovaikutuksen tyypin ja säteilyn energian mukaan (molekyylien pyöriminen, värähtely sekä elektroniset siirtymät).
  • osaa yksinkertaisissa systeemeissä yhdistää spektroskopista dataa kvanttimekaniikan teoriaan kemiallisesti mielenkiintoisten ominaisuuksien, kuten sidospituuksien ja dissosioitumisenergioiden selvittämiseksi.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Med avseende på inlärningskunskaper, studeranden
  • Utvecklar sin problemlösningsförmåga och klarar av att lösa öppnare problem än vanligt.
  • Rutineras i att begrunda kursmaterialet före kontaktundervisning. Studeranden lär sig granska sin egen läsning och kan förklara vad som är krävande i texten.
  • Fördjupar sin kunskap i att kritiskt evaluera sina egna samt andras arbeten.
  Med avseende på grunderna i kvantmekanik, studeranden
  • Känner till kvantmekanikens centrala begrepp och fenomen, såsom Schrödingers ekvation, vågfunktionen, kvantisering, Heisenbergs osäkerhetsprincip samt spin och kan tillämpa dessa både kvalitativt och kvantitativt på problem inom kemi.
  Med avseende på atomers och molekylers struktur, studeranden
  • Kan använda enkla kvantmekaniska modeller (t.ex. partikel i låda, harmonisk oscillator, rotation) för att beskriva partiklars beteende och kan tillämpa dessa modeller för att granska spektroskopiska fenomen.
  • Begriper genom den enklaste atommodellen (väteatomen) hur kvantmekanikens principer syns i atomers struktur och i periodiska systemet
  Med avseende på spektroskopi, studeranden
  • Känner till olika typer av spektroskopi och kan tillämpa den kvantmekaniska beskrivningen av atomer och molekyler för att beskriva växelverkan mellan strålning och materia. Studeranden kan klassificera de olika spektroskopityperna på basis av typen av växelverkan samt strålningens energi (molekylär rotation, vibration och elektroniska transitioner).
  • Kan kombinera spektroskopisk data med den kvantmekaniska teorin för att bestämma kemiskt intressanta egenskaper, såsom bindningslängder och dissociationsenergier för enkla system
learningOutcomes.en:
Regarding study skills the student
  • Develops his/her problem solving abilities and can solve more open problems than usual.
  • Becomes routinized in studying the course material before instruction. The student can monitor his reading and discuss what is challengin in the text.
  • Deepens their readiness to critically assess their own and other student s work.
  Regarding the fundamentals of quantum chemistry
  • Becomes familiar with the central quantum mechanical concepts and phenomena like the Schrödinger equation, the wave function, quantization, the Heisenberg uncertainty principle, and spin. He will also be able to apply these concepts at both the quantitative and qualitative levels to problems in chemistry.
  Regarding the structure of atoms and molecules the student can
  • Utilize simple quantum mechanical models (i.e. particle-in-a-box, harmonic oscillator, quantum mechanical rigid rotor), to model the behavior of particles and can apply these models to treat spectroscopical phenomena.
  • Describe how quantum mechanical principles manifest in atomic structure and the periodic table based on the simplest atomic model (the hydrogen atom).
Spectroscopy the student
  • Knows the principles of rotational, vibrational and electronic spectroscopy and can apply the quantum mechanical picture of atoms and molecules to describe the interactions between matter and electromagnetic radiation. The student can categorize different types of spectroscopies based on the range of energies involved.
  • Becomes familiar with some of the standard spectroscopic databases and can independently seek spectroscopic data. He/she knows how to combine spectroscopical data with quantum mechanical theory to determine properties like bond lengths and dissociation energies.

content.fi: Kvanttikemian perusteet, yksinkertainen atomimalli, sekä pyörimis- värähdys ja elektronispektroskopia.
content.sv: Grunderna i kvantkemi, den enklaste atommodellen, och olika varianter av spektroskopi (rotations, vibrations och elektronisk)
content.en: Fundamental principles of quantum chemistry, the simple atomic model, and vibrational, rotational and electronic spectroscopy.

substitutes.en: PHYS-A2140 Structure of Matter (CHEM), or CHEM-A1240 Quantum Mechanics and Spectroscopy of Atoms and Molecules

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan: Oppimistaitojen osalta opiskelija: - kehittää ongelmanratkaisutaitojaan ja pystyy ratkaisemaan myös tavallista avoimempia ongelmia.
- rutinoituu perehtymään kurssimateriaaliin ennen lähiopetusta ja oppii suuntaamaan huomionsa englanninkielisen oppikirjatekstin oleellisimpiin kohtiin.
- oppii kriittisesti arvioimaan omia ja muiden opiskelijoiden töitä.
Kemiallisen termodynamiikan perusteiden osalta opiskelija:
- hahmottaa termodynamiikan pääsääntöjen keskeisen roolin kemiassa ja osaa soveltaa pääsääntöjä käytännön elämässä
- ymmärtää termodynaamisten perussuureiden, kuten työn, lämmön, sisäenergian, entalpian, entropian, Gibbsin energian ja kemiallisen potentiaalin merkityksen sekä kytkökset näiden suureiden välillä.
- osaa laajasti soveltaa termodynamiikan keskeisimpiä suureita ja termodynaamista taulukkotietoa kemiallisten prosessien kvalitatiivisessa ja kvantitatiivisessa tarkastelussa.  Termodynaamisen tasapainon osalta opiskelija:
- tuntee termodynaamisen tasapainon eri osatekijät (kemiallinen-, faasi-, terminen- ja mekaaninen   tasapaino) ja ymmärtää näiden ja termodynamiikan perussuureiden välisiä yhteyksiä.
- oppii soveltamaan termodynaamisia taulukkotietoja kemiallisen ja faasitasapainon käsittelyssä ja ennustamaan kemiallisen prosessin käyttäytymistä eri olosuhteissa sekä lukemaan erilaisia faasidiagrammeja.
- syventää ymmärrystään kemiallisesta tasapainosta aktiivisuuden ja aktiivisuuskertoimen käsitteiden kautta. Opiskelija pystyy soveltamaan aktiivisuuksia todellisten systeemien tasapainoprosessien käsittelyssä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Lärandemål: Med avseende på studiefärdigheter, den studerande - utvecklar sin problemlösningsförmåga och kan även lösa öppnare problem än vanligt. - blir rutinerad i att studera kursmaterialet före kontaktundervisning och lär sig fokusera på den engelskspråkiga kurslitteraturens mest relevanta punkter. - lär sig kritiskt bedöma sin egen samt sina medstuderandens arbeten.   Med avseende på grundprinciper inom kemisk termodynamik, den studerande - förstår de termodynamiska huvudsatsernas centrala roll inom kemi och kan tillämpa dessa för att beskriva vardagliga fenomen. - förstår betydelsen och sambandet mellan fundamentala termodynamiska storheter såsom värme, inre energi, entalpi, entropi, Gibbs energi och kemisk potential. - kan tillämpa centrala termodynamiska storheter och data från termodynamiska tabeller i stor utsträckning för att beskriva kemiska processer både kvalitativt och kvantitativt.   Med avseende på kemisk jämvikt, den studerande - känner till de olika formerna av jämvikt (kemisk, fas, mekanisk och termisk jämvikt) samt förstår sambandet mellan dessa och de fundamentala termodynamiska storheterna. - lär sig tillämpa termokemiska tabeller vid behandling av fas- och kemisk jämvikt, förutspå beteendet av en kemisk process under olika förhållanden samt tolka olika typers fasdiagram. - fördjupar sin förståelse av kemisk jämvikt genom begreppen aktivitet och aktivitetskoefficient. Studenten behärskar tillämpningen av dessa begrepp vid behandling av jämvikt i reella system.
learningOutcomes.en: Learning Outcomes: Regarding study skills the student - develops his/her problem solving abilities and can solve more open problems than usual. - becomes routinized in studying the course material before instruction and learns to direct their attention to the central points of the course book. - learns to critically assess their own and other student s work.   Regarding the fundamentals of chemical thermodynamics the student - appreciates the central role of the laws of thermodynamics and knows how to apply these laws to everyday phenomena. - understands the meaning and connections between the fundamental thermodynamic properties like work, heat, internal energy, enthalpy, entropy, Gibbs energy, and chemical potential. - can broadly apply the central thermodynamic properties and data from thermodynamic tables to describe chemical processes both qualitatively and quantitatively.   Regarding chemical equilibrium the student -becomes familiar with the different types of equilibrium (chemical-, phase-, mechanical- and thermal equilibrium) and recognizes connections between these and the fundamental thermodynamic properties. -knows how to apply thermochemical tables in the treatment of phase and chemical equilibrium, how to predict the behavior of a chemical process in different conditions, and how to read phase diagrams. -deepens his/her comprehension of the chemical equilibrium through the concepts of activity and activity coefficient. The student also learns how to employ these concepts in the treatment of equilibrium in real systems.

content.fi: Termodynamiikan pääsäännöt ja keskeiset termodynaamiset suureet. Kemiallinen tasapainot. Puhtaiden aineiden ja ideaali- ja reaaliseosten faasitasapainot. Yksinkertaiset faasidiagrammit.
content.sv: Termodynamikens huvudsatser och de grundläggande termodynamiska storheterna. Kemisk jämvikt. Fasjämvikt för rena ämnen och för ideala och reella blandningar. Enkla fasdiagram.
content.en: Laws of thermodynamics and the fundamental thermodynamic properties. Chemical equilibrium. Phase equilibria of pure substances. Phase equilibria of ideal and real mixtures. Simple phase diagrams.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the courese, the students should be able to: 
- explain how enzyme catalysis works (on a very fundamental level: drawing "reaction coordinate vs. free energy" diagrams) 
- name different methods for protein engineering and evaluate their potential 
- draw chemical reaction mechanisms relevant for biochemistry ("pushing electrons") 
- describe the composition and reactivity of important biomolecules 
- visualize the 3D structure of proteins via the softwar PyMol 
- present scientific concepts to peers 
- search and evaluate state-of-the-art science

content.fi: Repetition of fundamental chemistry related to biochemistry. Revision of amino acids and non-covalent forces responsible for the 3D structure of proteins (going more into detail than CHEM-A1310 or CHEM-C1300). Bioenergetics (thermodynamics relevant for biochemistry). Theoretic analysis of enzyme catalysis. Draw reaction coordinates and interpret them. Principles of how to develop an enzyme inhibitor. Enzyme kinetics with one substrate. Comparison of enzyme catalysis vs. classical catalysis. Cofactors. Enzyme engineering and selected strategies to do this, including directed evolution. Biocatalysis and applications.

Bioenergetics (thermodynamics relevant for biochemistry). Theoretic analysis of enzyme catalysis. Draw reaction coordinates and interpret them. Principles of how to develop an enzyme inhibitor. Enzyme kinetics with one substrate. Comparison of enzyme catalysis vs. classical catalysis. Cofactors. Enzyme engineering and selected strategies to do this, including directed evolution. Biocatalysis and applications.

Enzyme kinetics with one substrate. Comparison of enzyme catalysis vs. classical catalysis. Cofactors. Enzyme engineering and selected strategies to do this, including directed evolution. Biocatalysis and applications.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, the student
  • Knows the basic functions of the given softwares (PovRay, Chimera Blender).
  • Can identify creative and artistic ways of presenting science.
  • Is able to produce 3D rendered images.
  • Can produce simple animations.
  • Can start working on a visualization topic from own study / research field.

content.fi: The course provides basic software tools for visualization, 3D modelling and rendering. The aim is to promote creativeness and artistic way of presenting science. Special focus is placed on the visualization small organic compounds, biomolecules and their animations. The course uses three free open-source softwares: UCSF Chimera (protein and volume structures), PovRay (text-based scene description) and Blender (3D modelling with GUI). Project work is focused to help the students own key points in scientific productions and presentations.

learningOutcomes.fi:
On completion of this course, the student will be able to:
  1. Associate the cellular structures of microorganisms with their roles in physiology.
  2. Explain microbial growth dynamics, discuss the associated cellular processes, and quantitatively assess population growth.
  3. Discuss the regulatory mechanisms of microorganisms and analyze them in terms of resource use and speed of adaptation.
  4. Examine diverse strategies of microorganisms to fulfil fundamental metabolic needs and analyze microbial metabolism using computational tools.
  5. Appraise the mechanisms of genomic changes in microbial cells and evolution.
  6. Discuss assessing microbial community composition and function.

  4. Examine diverse strategies of microorganisms to fulfil fundamental metabolic needs and analyze microbial metabolism using computational tools.
  5. Appraise the mechanisms of genomic changes in microbial cells and evolution.
  6. Discuss assessing microbial community composition and function.

  3. Discuss the regulatory mechanisms of microorganisms and analyze them in terms of resource use and speed of adaptation.
  4. Examine diverse strategies of microorganisms to fulfil fundamental metabolic needs and analyze microbial metabolism using computational tools.
  5. Appraise the mechanisms of genomic changes in microbial cells and evolution.
  6. Discuss assessing microbial community composition and function.

content.fi: This course will provide a comprehensive exploration of microbial physiology, unraveling the role of cellular structures, mechanisms, and processes in sustaining life across diverse environmental conditions and influencing the performance of cells in biotechnological applications. Encoding of the cellular capabilities in the genome and how the genomes can change and evolve will be investigated. Quantitative aspects of microbial physiology will be delved into and evaluated in single-species populations and microbial communities through computational tools.

name.en: Atomic-level Modelling Using Computational Chemistry Methods D, Lecture

workload.fi:
Lectures, weekly exercises and assignments.
In total, 135 h of work.
workload.sv:
Lectures, weekly exercises and assignments.
In total, 135 h of work.
workload.en:
Lectures, weekly exercises and assignments.
In total, 135 h of work.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E4114 Computational Methods or similar knowledge.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E4114 Computational Methods or similar knowledge.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E4114 Computational Methods or similar knowledge.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After this course the students will be familiar 
  1. the basics of many electron quantum mechanics and the Hartree-Fock (HF) method
  2. how such problems are solved numerically and the concept of basis set
  3. quantum chemical modelling beyond the HF method. These include the MP2, Coupled Cluster and Density Functional methods
  4. quantum chemical modelling of molecules, solid systems and surfaces 
  5. how to model chemical reactions. The NEB method and thermodynamical integration
  6. ab initio molecular dynamics and time dependent DFT.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After this course the students will be familiar 
  1. the basics of many electron quantum mechanics and the Hartree-Fock (HF) method
  2. how such problems are solved numerically and the concept of basis set
  3. quantum chemical modelling beyond the HF method. These include the MP2, Coupled Cluster and Density Functional methods
  4. quantum chemical modelling of molecules, solid systems and surfaces 
  5. how to model chemical reactions. The NEB method and thermodynamical integration
  6. ab initio molecular dynamics and time dependent DFT.
learningOutcomes.en:
After this course the students will be familiar 
  1. the basics of many electron quantum mechanics and the Hartree-Fock (HF) method
  2. how such problems are solved numerically and the concept of basis set
  3. quantum chemical modelling beyond the HF method. These include the MP2, Coupled Cluster and Density Functional methods
  4. quantum chemical modelling of molecules, solid systems and surfaces 
  5. how to model chemical reactions. The NEB method and thermodynamical integration
  6. ab initio molecular dynamics and time dependent DFT.

content.fi:
Common quantum chemical methods, like Hartree-Fock, MP2 and DFT and some modelling programms like Orca and GPAW. 
How to model molecules, solid systems and surfaces. 
How to compute properties of molecules, like infrared spectra or binding energy to a surface. 
How to model chemical reactions.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, the student
  • has the basic knowledge of most common atomistic and coarse-grained modelling approaches to biomolecular and polymeric systems. The focus is on force-field based, deterministic interactions computational approaches.
  • is able to consider soft materials systems at different modelling length and time scales computationally, and extract materials response predictions in terms of assembly and mechanical characteristics by the simplified models.
  • can employ the learned modelling principles and approaches to set up and examine computationally e.g. solvation response, intermolecular interactions, self-assembly and physical kinetics, such as diffusion, in simple soft matter systems in solution.
  • is able to interpret, design, and test simple soft materials systems responses using computational approaches.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course, the student
  • has the basic knowledge of most common atomistic and coarse-grained modelling approaches to biomolecular and polymeric systems. The focus is on force-field based, deterministic interactions computational approaches.
  • is able to consider soft materials systems at different modelling length and time scales computationally, and extract materials response predictions in terms of assembly and mechanical characteristics by the simplified models.
  • can employ the learned modelling principles and approaches to set up and examine computationally e.g. solvation response, intermolecular interactions, self-assembly and physical kinetics, such as diffusion, in simple soft matter systems in solution.
  • is able to interpret, design, and test simple soft materials systems responses using computational approaches.

After the course, the student
  • has the basic knowledge of most common atomistic and coarse-grained modelling approaches to biomolecular and polymeric systems. The focus is on force-field based, deterministic interactions computational approaches.
  • is able to consider soft materials systems at different modelling length and time scales computationally, and extract materials response predictions in terms of assembly and mechanical characteristics by the simplified models.
  • can employ the learned modelling principles and approaches to set up and examine computationally e.g. solvation response, intermolecular interactions, self-assembly and physical kinetics, such as diffusion, in simple soft matter systems in solution.
  • is able to interpret, design, and test simple soft materials systems responses using computational approaches.

learningOutcomes.fi:
-student recognizes that there are different ways of how concept "functional" or "smart" material are used in the literature, and what kind of justifications can be used
-student can understand and apply main concepts of soft materials/polymers physics and chemistry
-student knows what kind of functional soft materials are currently envisioned for uses in the fields of biomedicine, renewable energy conversion, sensors, organic electronics, textiles and coatings/substrates
-student knows what kind of methods can be applied for evaluating the environmental impacts of new materials and material fabrication processes
-student learns to prepare a presentation for a scientific meeting

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will
  • understand the fundamental properties of minerals and their relevance in mineral enrichment and recycling operations
  • generate material balances from experimental observations and analyze process performance
  • understand the principles of grinding, liberation and classification,
  • understand the properties of solid particles and slurries and their means of transport
  • understand basic mineral properties and how to exploit them in enrichment operation technologies,
  • understand the effects of liberation on processing and recycling from a product-centric viewpoint

  • understand basic mineral properties and how to exploit them in enrichment operation technologies,

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.Recommended prerequisites: Recommended also CHEM-E7121 Separation Processes 1 D and CHEM-E7126 Separation Processes 2 D.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
  • has hands on experience in experimental laboratory work of the selected case
  • is capable of finding and combining information on various subjects of unit operations and unit processes
  • understands the operation principles of the laboratory scale apparatus and its relation to catalyzed chemical reactions as well as phase and reaction equilibrium
  • is capable of analyzing the compositions of the streams or properties of the products in practice
  • is capable of working in group and organizing the work load in a meaningful way

content.fi:
• Safety aspects of laboratory work and economic potential of the selected case,
  • comparison of process alternatives,
  • planning of laboratory scale experiments,
  • running the experiments to produce and separate a chemical component, analyzing the composition with the relevant technique,
  • laboratory diary, reporting and seminar presentation.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Recommended that the student knows chemical engineering thermodynamics and separation processes at bachelor level, for example CHEM-C2160 Yksikköoperaatiot or similar.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
*is able to utilize phase equilibrium data in design of separation processes
*is able to design unit operations in product purification and solvent recycling
*is capable of modelling and designing separation processes
*is capable to apply process simulators in solving mass and energy balances of separation processes

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, the participant will understand:
  • Basic principles of design of experiments;
  • Basic experimental design strategies (factorial, composite, response-surface, mixture design) and associated solution techniques for practical calculations.
  • Basic principles of calibration;
  • Basic calibration methods (linear regression, principal component analysis, partial least-squares) and associated solution techniques for practical calculations.

content.fi: We study the introductory principles and the basic calculation techniques of experimental design and multivariate calibration. The course aims at providing a pragmatic understanding of the techniques and a practical workflow for using experimental data.
content.sv: We study the introductory principles and the basic calculation techniques of experimental design and multivariate calibration. The course aims at providing a pragmatic understanding of the techniques and a practical workflow for using experimental data.
content.en: We study the introductory principles and the basic calculation techniques of experimental design and multivariate calibration. The course aims at providing a pragmatic understanding of the techniques and a practical workflow for using experimental data.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
*Understands the process dynamics and nonlinearities of typical chemical processes and coupling between physical phenomena
*Can model chemical processes and carry out model based analysis
*Can solve mechanistic process models using appropriate numerical techniques
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course the student *Understands the process dynamics and nonlinearities of typical chemical processes and coupling between physical phenomena *Can model chemical processes and carry out model based analysis *Can solve mechanistic process models using appropriate numerical techniques
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student *Understands the process dynamics and nonlinearities of typical chemical processes and coupling between physical phenomena *Can model chemical processes and carry out model based analysis *Can solve mechanistic process models using appropriate numerical techniques

content.fi: Dynamical process modeling with material and energy balances Effect of rate models (mass and heat transfer, reaction rates) on modeling Specific topics in mass transfer: multicomponent mass transfer, non-conventional driving forces, population balances Numerical methods to solve typical mechanistic models in chemical engineering including algebraic, ordinary and partial differential equations. Reactor and unsteady heat transfer modeling examples. Implementation of the models and numerical methods using Matlab/Simulink Homework assignment: Numeric Solving of differential equations; first principle modelling of process units
content.sv: Dynamical process modeling with material and energy balances Effect of rate models (mass and heat transfer, reaction rates) on modeling Specific topics in mass transfer: multicomponent mass transfer, non-conventional driving forces, population balances Numerical methods to solve typical mechanistic models in chemical engineering including algebraic, ordinary and partial differential equations. Reactor and unsteady heat transfer modeling examples. Implementation of the models and numerical methods using Matlab/Simulink Homework assignment: Numeric Solving of differential equations; first principle modelling of process units
content.en: Dynamical process modeling with material and energy balances Effect of rate models (mass and heat transfer, reaction rates) on modeling Specific topics in mass transfer: multicomponent mass transfer, non-conventional driving forces, population balances Numerical methods to solve typical mechanistic models in chemical engineering including algebraic, ordinary and partial differential equations. Reactor and unsteady heat transfer modeling examples. Implementation of the models and numerical methods using Matlab/Simulink Homework assignment: Numeric Solving of differential equations; first principle modelling of process units

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
*Knows the most important systems of the production planning and optimization used in the process industries, their structure and operation principles;
*Knows the most important operation research areas and their typical problems;
*Is able to use linear programming: Simplex methods and its variants;
*Knows the methods for transportation, inventory and supply chain optimization;
*Knows dynamic programming, integer programming and nonlinear programming methods and their use;
*Knows most common scheduling methods and their use.

content.fi: The aim of the course is to give knowledge about methods used in production planning and optimization of industrial processes. Applications of production control are also discussed. Assignments where students have two weeks to individually model and solve an optimization problem in: - Supply chain optimization (LP) - Production scheduling (MILP)

prerequisites.fi: There are no prerequisites for this course and students from different masters programs and schools are welcome to take the course.  However, as the course is focused in the first hand for students pursuing a masters degree in business.  Thus, students who have not taken any business courses previously need to be willing to do some additional self study.  If you have any questions if your background is suitable for the course, feel free to contact the professor.

prerequisites.en: There are no prerequisites for this course and students from different masters programs and schools are welcoemd to take the course.  However, as the course is focused in the first hand for students pursuing a masters degree in business.  Thus, students who have not taken any business courses previously need to be willing to do some additional self study.  If you have any questions if your background is suitable for the course, feel free to contact the professor.

learningOutcomes.fi: This course explores how firms can best start, develop, and manage their international activities.  Students will learn about the internationalization process, entry strategy, entry mode choice, mergers and acquisitions, global supply chains, the management of international operations, and international negotiations. We will study both small firms and large multinationals.
learningOutcomes.sv: This course explores how firms can best start, develop, and manage their international activities.  Students will learn about the internationalization process, entry strategy, entry mode choice, mergers and acquisitions, global supply chains, the management of international operations, and international negotiations. We will study both small firms and large multinationals.
learningOutcomes.en: This course explores how firms can best start, develop, and manage their international activities.  Students will learn about the internationalization process, entry strategy, entry mode choice, mergers and acquisitions, global supply chains, the management of international operations, and international negotiations. We will study both small firms and large multinationals.

content.fi:
During the course, the following questions will be examined: (1) Why and how do firms internationalize? (2) What challenges do firms have as they start, develop, and manage their international operations and what can be done to overcome these challenges and be successful in international business? (3) What are the advantages and disadvantages of different entry modes and internationalization strategies and how can they best be designed and managed? (4) How can one conduct international negotiations successfully? (5) What are some strategies for succesfully managing international operations? (6) How is it best to design and manage mergers and acquisitions?; and (7) What are key issues to consider relating to international suply chains?  
The course will include guests who are senior executives and will share their industry experience.  The course has a strong practical focus and will seek to forge links between theory and practice and illustrate practical applications of the material discussed during the course. Material covered in the course is taught in a way that it is useful in practice.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: lukion matematiikka.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: gymnasiets matematik.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: high school mathematics.

learningOutcomes.fi:
1. Matemaatiset taidot: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija:
    1. ymmärtää todistuksen käsitteen sekä tämän välttämättömyyden.
    2. osaa muodostaa matemaattisia väitteitä joukkojen, funktioiden ja loogisten symbolien avulla.
    3. pystyy käyttämään induktioperiaatetta eri tilanteissa.
    4. tietää miten lasketaan kombinatorisesti määriteltyjä objekteja tuloperiaatteen ja seulayhtälön avulla.
    5. osaa muodostaa verkkoja, jotka esittävät sekä tieteellisiä että arkisia tilanteita.
    6. pystyy ratkaisemaan pienien verkkojen väritys- ja viritysongelmia heuristisesti.
    7. osaa ratkaista Diofantoksen yhtälöitä sekä käyttää modulaariaritmetiikkaa.
  2. Yleiset taidot: Kurssilla opiskelija oppii 
    1. ratkaisemaan ongelmia ryhmän jäsenenä.
    2. kommunikoimaan matemaattisia ajatuksia kirjallisesti ja suullisesti.
learningOutcomes.sv:
1. Matematiska färdigheter: Efter att ha avklarat denna kurs skall studenten:
    1. förstå begreppet bevis samt dess betydelse.
    2. kunna formulera matematiska utsagor med hjälp av av mängder, funktioner och logiska symboler.
    3. kunna tillämpa induktionsprincipen i olika situationer.
    4. veta hur man räknar kombinatoriskt definierade objekt med multiplikationsprincipen och inklusions-exklusionsprincipen.
    5. kunna konstruera grafer som beskriver både vardagliga och vetenskapliga situationer.
    6. heuristiskt kunna lösa problem med färgläggningar och uppspännande träd i små grafer.
    7. kunna lösa lineära Diofantiska ekvationer och räkna i modulararitmetik.
  2. Generiska färdigheter: Genom kursen utvecklar studenten sin förmåga att
    1. samarbeta för att lösa problem i grupp.
    2. uttrycka matematiska idéer koherent skriftligen och muntligen.
learningOutcomes.en:
1. Mathematical skills: After completing the course, the student:
    1. understands the concept of proof and its necessity.
    2. is able to formulate mathematical statements using sets, functions and logical symbols.
    3. is able to apply the induction principle in various situations.
    4. knows how to count combinatorially defined objects using the multiplication principle and the principle of inclusion-exclusion.
    5. can construct graphs describing both everyday and scientific situations.
    6. is able to heuristically solve colouring and spanning tree problems on small graphs.
    7. can solve linear Diophantine equations and compute in modular arithmetic.
  2. Generic skills: Through the course, the student develops their ability to
    1. collaborate to solve problems in groups.
    2. communicate mathematical ideas coherently in written and oral form.

content.fi: matemaattinen logiikka, joukot, funktiot, relaatiot, kombinatoriikka, induktio ja rekursio, modulaariaritmetiikka, permutaatio- ja symmetriaryhmät, verkot.
content.sv: logik, mängder, funktioner, relationer, kombinatorik, induktion och rekursion, modulär aritmetik, permutations- och symmetrigrupper, grafer.
content.en: logic, sets, functions, relations, combinatorics, induction and recursion, modular arithmetic, permutation groups and symmetry groups, graphs.

learningOutcomes.fi: The students learn to formulate, analyze and interpret economic models in environmental economics analytically and learn the conceptual basis for instrument design. Students become familiar with the main policy questions and acquire analytical and reporting skills to analyze real world challenges related to the economic use of the environment.
learningOutcomes.sv: The students learn to formulate, analyze and interpret economic models in environmental economics analytically and learn the conceptual basis for instrument design. Students become familiar with the main policy questions and acquire analytical and reporting skills to analyze real world challenges related to the economic use of the environment.
learningOutcomes.en:
The students learn to formulate, analyze and interpret economic models 
in environmental economics analytically and learn the conceptual basis 
for instrument design. Students become familiar with the main policy 
questions and acquire analytical and reporting skills to analyze real 
world challenges related to the economic use of the environment.

content.fi: This is an advanced course on the modern theory of environmental and economics that covers the environmental externality and instrument design problems. The first part of the course focuses on the policy design and instrument choice, with a special focus on the problems arising from asymmetric information. The second part considers the policies in a general equilibrium context that is relevant for climate change. Lectures cover the theory; readings cover both theory and empirics.
content.sv: This is an advanced course on the modern theory of environmental and economics that covers the environmental externality and instrument design problems. The first part of the course focuses on the policy design and instrument choice, with a special focus on the problems arising from asymmetric information. The second part considers the policies in a general equilibrium context that is relevant for climate change. Lectures cover the theory; readings cover both theory and empirics.
content.en:
This is an advanced course on the modern theory of environmental and 
economics that covers the environmental externality and instrument 
design problems. The first part of the course focuses on the policy 
design and instrument choice, with a special focus on the problems 
arising from asymmetric information. The second part considers the 
policies in a general equilibrium context that is relevant for climate 
change. Lectures cover the theory; readings cover both theory and 
empirics.

learningOutcomes.fi: Opintojakson jälkeen opiskelija pystyy ymmärtämään ja arvioimaan filosofista lähestymistapaa tieteeseen.

content.fi: Tieteen ja tieteellisen ajattelun tunnuspiirteiden systemaattinen tarkastelu sekä eri aikojen käsitykset tieteen tavoitteista, menetelmistä sekä tieteellisen tiedon luonteesta. Tieteen ja tekniikan suhde eri aikoina. Matemaattisten ja fysikaalisten tieteiden perusteet, tavoitteet ja menetelmät filosofisesta näkökulmasta. Myös historiallinen kehitys antiikin ajattelijoista tieteiden vallankumoukseen ja edelleen nykypäivän keskeisiin näkemyksiin asti. Logiikka ja argumentaatioteoria, tieteellinen päättely, sen luonne ja tavoitteet, tieteellinen selittäminen ja kausaliteetin ongelmat. Tieteen etiikka ja tieteellinen maailmankuva. Tiedon kasvuun ja tieteen kehitykseen liittyvät kysymykset.
content.sv:
En systematisk behandling av de utmärkande dragen i vetenskapen och det vetenskapliga tänkandet och uppfattningar under olika tidevarv om metoder och målsättningar för vetenskapen och arten av vetenskaplig kunskap.
Grunder, målsättningar och metoder i de matematiska och fysikaliska vetenskaperna ur en filosofisk synvinkel. Den historiska utvecklingen från antikens tänkare till den vetenskapliga revolutionen och vidare till centrala nutida åsikter. Logik och argumentationsteori. Vetenskaplig slutledning, dess natur och målsättningar. Vetenskapliga förklaringar och kausalitetsproblem. Vetenskapens etik och den vetenskapliga världsbilden. Frågor som gäller kunskapstillväxten och utvecklingen av vetenskapen.
content.en: The course deals mainly the foundations, objectives, and the methods in the mathematical and physical sciences from a philosophical point of view. The course proceeds historically from the philosophers of antiquity to the scientific revolution and from there to the essential modern philosophies. The characteristic features of science and of scientific thinking are systematically treated as well as concepts about the methods and the objectives of science and the nature of scientific knowledge during different periods. Systematical consideration of science and scientific thinking and the conceptions concerning objectives, methods and the nature of scientific knowledge during different times. Foundations, objectives and methods of mathematical and physical sciences from the philosophical point of view. The historical development from antiquity through the scientific revolution until the main perspectives of modern times. The scientific establishment of theories and concepts, scientific reasoning, its nature and objectives, scientific explanation and causality, the ethics of science and questions pertaining to the scientific world view, growth of knowledge and the development of science.

prerequisites.fi: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX. The courses MS-A03XX, MS-C134X, MS-C1350, MS-C1650 may also be useful.
prerequisites.sv: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX. The courses MS-A03XX, MS-C134X, MS-C1350, MS-C1650 may also be useful.
prerequisites.en: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX. The courses MS-A03XX, MS-C134X, MS-C1350, MS-C1650 may also be useful.

learningOutcomes.fi: You will familiarize yourself with the basic properties of initial value problems for systems of ordinary differential equations. You will learn the fundamental theory about linear multistep methods (definition, consistency, zero-stability, convergence) and Runge-Kutta methods (definition, order conditions, convergence). You will learn to identify a stiff system and to understand the difference between explicit and implicit numerical schemes. You will understand the signifigance of absolute stability and A-stability, and know how to examine the region of absolute stability for a given numerical method. You will familiarize yourself with simple parabolic and hyperpolic initial/boundary value problems and learn how to discretize them with the help of difference schemes. You will practice implementing the introduced methods numerically.
learningOutcomes.sv: You will familiarize yourself with the basic properties of initial value problems for systems of ordinary differential equations. You will learn the fundamental theory about linear multistep methods (definition, consistency, zero-stability, convergence) and Runge-Kutta methods (definition, order conditions, convergence). You will learn to identify a stiff system and to understand the difference between explicit and implicit numerical schemes. You will understand the signifigance of absolute stability and A-stability, and know how to examine the region of absolute stability for a given numerical method. You will familiarize yourself with simple parabolic and hyperpolic initial/boundary value problems and learn how to discretize them with the help of difference schemes. You will practice implementing the introduced methods numerically.
learningOutcomes.en: You will familiarize yourself with the basic properties of initial value problems for systems of ordinary differential equations. You will learn the fundamental theory about linear multistep methods (definition, consistency, zero-stability, convergence) and Runge-Kutta methods (definition, order conditions, convergence). You will learn to identify a stiff system and to understand the difference between explicit and implicit numerical schemes. You will understand the signifigance of absolute stability and A-stability, and know how to examine the region of absolute stability for a given numerical method. You will familiarize yourself with simple parabolic and hyperpolic initial/boundary value problems and learn how to discretize them with the help of difference schemes. You will practice implementing the introduced methods numerically.

learningOutcomes.fi: The students learn to formulate, analyze and interpret economic models in environmental economics analytically and learn the conceptual basis for instrument design. Students become familiar with the main policy questions and acquire analytical and reporting skills to analyze real world challenges related to the economic use of the environment.
learningOutcomes.sv: The students learn to formulate, analyze and interpret economic models in environmental economics analytically and learn the conceptual basis for instrument design. Students become familiar with the main policy questions and acquire analytical and reporting skills to analyze real world challenges related to the economic use of the environment.
learningOutcomes.en:
The students learn to formulate, analyze and interpret economic models 
in environmental economics analytically and learn the conceptual basis 
for instrument design. Students become familiar with the main policy 
questions and acquire analytical and reporting skills to analyze real 
world challenges related to the economic use of the environment.

content.fi: This is an advanced course on the modern theory of environmental and economics that covers the environmental externality and instrument design problems. The first part of the course focuses on the policy design and instrument choice, with a special focus on the problems arising from asymmetric information. The second part considers the policies in a general equilibrium context that is relevant for climate change. Lectures cover the theory; readings cover both theory and empirics.
content.sv: This is an advanced course on the modern theory of environmental and economics that covers the environmental externality and instrument design problems. The first part of the course focuses on the policy design and instrument choice, with a special focus on the problems arising from asymmetric information. The second part considers the policies in a general equilibrium context that is relevant for climate change. Lectures cover the theory; readings cover both theory and empirics.
content.en:
This is an advanced course on the modern theory of environmental and 
economics that covers the environmental externality and instrument 
design problems. The first part of the course focuses on the policy 
design and instrument choice, with a special focus on the problems 
arising from asymmetric information. The second part considers the 
policies in a general equilibrium context that is relevant for climate 
change. Lectures cover the theory; readings cover both theory and 
empirics.

learningOutcomes.fi: The main objective is to understand the nature of complex networked systems. The course will provide students with fundamentals of networked systems and interdisciplinary perspective and tools to analyse and understand the extremely large-scale complex ecosystem of communications systems, in which technical, economic, and social aspects are intermixed in a dynamic fashion.
learningOutcomes.sv: The main objective is to understand the nature of complex networked systems. The course will provide students with fundamentals of networked systems and interdisciplinary perspective and tools to analyse and understand the extremely large-scale complex ecosystem of communications systems, in which technical, economic, and social aspects are intermixed in a dynamic fashion.
learningOutcomes.en: The main objective is to understand the nature of complex networked systems. The course will provide students with fundamentals of networked systems and interdisciplinary perspective and tools to analyse and understand the extremely large-scale complex ecosystem of communications systems, in which technical, economic, and social aspects are intermixed in a dynamic fashion.

content.fi: Introduction to networked and complex systems; fundamentals and basic concepts. Fundamental models of large networked systems, small-world network, and scale-free networks. Complexity of simple, chaotic, and extremely complex systems. Long-tail models. The role of human behaviour and quality of experience. Tragedy of commons and selfish behaviour in networked world.
content.sv: Introduction to networked and complex systems; fundamentals and basic concepts. Fundamental models of large networked systems, small-world network, and scale-free networks. Complexity of simple, chaotic, and extremely complex systems. Long-tail models. The role of human behaviour and quality of experience. Tragedy of commons and selfish behaviour in networked world.
content.en: Introduction to networked and complex systems; fundamentals and basic concepts. Fundamental models of large networked systems, small-world network, and scale-free networks. Complexity of simple, chaotic, and extremely complex systems. Long-tail models. The role of human behaviour and quality of experience. Tragedy of commons and selfish behaviour in networked world.

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisitesBasic statistics or econometrics course as a prerequisite.Recommended prerequisitesBasic economics and finance are recommended.
prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisitesBasic statistics or econometrics course as a prerequisite.Recommended prerequisitesBasic economics and finance are recommended.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisitesBasic statistics or econometrics course as a prerequisite.Recommended prerequisitesBasic economics and finance are recommended.

learningOutcomes.fi: By the end of the course, students will be able to design, implement, and critically evaluate experiments in economics and finance. They will develop a strong understanding of how to interpret experimental data, assess the validity of results, and apply these techniques to both academic research and real-world business problems.
learningOutcomes.sv: By the end of the course, students will be able to design, implement, and critically evaluate experiments in economics and finance. They will develop a strong understanding of how to interpret experimental data, assess the validity of results, and apply these techniques to both academic research and real-world business problems.
learningOutcomes.en: By the end of the course, students will be able to design, implement, and critically evaluate experiments in economics and finance. They will develop a strong understanding of how to interpret experimental data, assess the validity of results, and apply these techniques to both academic research and real-world business problems.

content.fi: This course provides a foundational understanding of experimental methods in economics and finance, with applications in both research and business settings. It introduces key concepts of experimental methodology, covers important categories of experiments, and explores applications from Nobel Prize-winning research to A/B testing in innovative companies. Students will learn how to design, conduct, and critically assess experiments within the fields of economics and finance.
content.sv: This course provides a foundational understanding of experimental methods in economics and finance, with applications in both research and business settings. It introduces key concepts of experimental methodology, covers important categories of experiments, and explores applications from Nobel Prize-winning research to A/B testing in innovative companies. Students will learn how to design, conduct, and critically assess experiments within the fields of economics and finance.
content.en:
This course provides a foundational
understanding of experimental methods in economics and finance, with
applications in both research and business settings. It introduces key concepts
of experimental methodology, covers important categories of experiments, and
explores applications from Nobel Prize-winning research to A/B testing in
innovative companies. Students will learn how to design, conduct, and
critically assess experiments within the fields of economics and finance.

workload.fi: Kandidaatintyöhön ja seminaariin kuuluu aktiivinen osallistuminen luennoille ja työpajoihin, harjoitustehtävät, kandidaatintyön kirjoittaminen, seminaari ja opponointi. Kurssi sisältää osioita ja tehtäviä, jotka ovat osallistujalle pakollisia. Näistä ilmoitetaan tarkemmin MyCourses -oppimisympäristössä.
workload.sv: Kandidatarbetet och seminariet innefattar aktivt deltagande i föreläsningar och workshops, övningsuppgifter, skrivande av kandidatarbete, seminarium och opposition. Kursen innehåller avsnitt och uppgifter som är obligatoriska för deltagaren. Dessa redovisas mer i detalj i MyCourses lärmiljö.
workload.en: The bachelor's thesis and seminar includes active participation in lectures and workshops, exercises, writing the bachelor's thesis, presentation of the bachelor's thesis in the seminar and opposing another student's bachelor's thesis. The course contains sections and assignments that are mandatory for the participant. These are reported in more detail in the MyCourses learning environment.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Vahvistettu HOPS. On suositeltavaa, että kurssille osallistutaan joko kolmannen opiskeluvuoden syksyllä tai keväällä.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Bekräftad ISP. Det rekommenderas att kursen gås antingen på hösten eller våren under tredje studieåret.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Confirmed HOPS. It is recommended that the course is taken either in the fall or spring of the third year of study.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin jälkeen opiskelijalla on käytännön valmius teknistieteellisen raportin tiedonhakuun, laadintaan ja esittelyyn. Kurssin aikana opiskelija tuottaa kandidaatin tutkintoon vaadittavan opinnäytetyön.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen har studenten en praktisk beredskap att söka information, utarbeta och presentera en teknisk vetenskaplig rapport.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course, the student has skills and abilities for searching for information, preparing and presenting a technical scientific report. During the course the student will write the thesis required for the bachelor's degree.

content.fi: Kurssilla perehdytään tieteelliseen kirjoittamiseen ja akateemisiin viestintätaitoihin. Kurssilla opetellaan tiedonhaun, tieteellisen ajattelun, tiedon jäsentämisen ja käsittelyn sekä ammatillisen kielenkäytön ja viestinnän taitoja. Kurssin aikana kirjoitetaan pääaineen alaan liittyvästä aiheesta kandidaatintyö, joka esitellään seminaaritilaisuudessa. Kurssin yhteydessä annetaan kypsyysnäyte (ENG1000.kyps), mikä tapahtuu prosessimaisella kirjoitus- ja palautetyöskentelyllä kurssin yhteydessä.Kurssi sisältää perehtymistä tutkimusviestintään, joka jakaantuu tieteellisen kirjoittamiseen ja puheviestintään. Kurssin sisällön tarkemmista yksityiskohdista kerrotaan MyCourses-oppimisympäristössä.
content.sv: Kursen lär vetenskapligt och kritiskt tänkande, sökning, strukturering och behandling av information och språk- och kommunikationsfärdigheter.
content.en: The course introduces the student to scientific writing and academic communication skills. The course teaches the skills of searching for information, scientific thinking, structuring and processing information, as well as professional language use and communication. During the course, a bachelor's thesis is written on a topic related to the field of the major. The thesis is presented at the seminar. A maturity demonstration (ENG1000.kyps) is given as a part of the course. The course includes an introduction to research communication, which is divided into scientific writing and speech communication. More detailed information about the course content is provided in the MyCourses learning environment.

assesmentMethods.fi: Harjoitustehtävät, välipalautukset, osallistuminen teksti- ja puhepajoihin, kandidaatintyö ja seminaari.
assesmentMethods.sv: Övningsuppgifter, deluppgifter, deltagande i text- och talworkshops, kandidatarbete och seminarium.
assesmentMethods.en: Exercise assignments, midterm reviews, participation in text and speech workshops, bachelor's thesis and seminar.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: PHYS-A0110 Yliopistofysiikan perusteet, PHYS-A0130 Sähkömagnetismi, MS-A0101 Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1, tai vastaavat kurssit.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: PHYS-A0110 Yliopistofysiikan perusteet, PHYS-A0130 Sähkömagnetismi, MS-A0101 Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1, eller motsvarande kurser.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: PHYS-A0110 Yliopistofysiikan perusteet, PHYS-A0130 Sähkömagnetismi, MS-A0101 Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1, or corresponding courses.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin käytyään opiskelija
1. tuntee etenevän aaltoliikkeen peruskäsitteet
2. osaa selittää aaltoliikkeen interferenssi- ja diffraktiokuvioiden intensiteettijakauman muodostumisen
3. tuntee Heisenbergin epätarkkuusperiaatteen sekä kvanttimekaniikan aalto-hiukkasdualismin
4. osaa ratkaista yksinkertaisia kvanttimekaanisia systeemejä Schrödingerin yhtälön avulla
5. tunnistaa atomien ja kiinteän aineen ominaisuuksia pohjautuen kvanttimekaniikkaan
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter slutförd kurs
1. är du bekant med grundbegrepp kring fortskridande vågrörelse
2. kan du förklara hur intensitetsfördelningen för vågrörelsens interferens- och diffraktionsmönster uppstår
3. är du bekant med Heisenbergs osäkerhetsprincip samt kvantmekanikens våg-partikeldualitet
4. kan du lösa enkla kvantmekaniska system med hjälp av Schrödingerekvationen
5. kan du koppla ihop egenskaper hos atomer och fast materia baserat på kvantmekanik.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, the student
1. knows the basics of wave propagation
2. can explain the formation of intensity distribution in interference and diffraction patterns
3. knows the Heisenberg's uncertainty principle and the wave-particle dualism in quantum mechanics
4. can solve simple quantum mechanical systems using Schrödinger's equation
5. can identify properties of atoms and condensed matter based on quantum mechanics

content.fi: Interferenssi, diffraktio, dispersio, ryhmä- ja vaihenopeus. Heisenbergin epätarkkuusperiaate, aalto-hiukkas-dualismi. Schrödingerin yhtälö, kvanttimekaniikan todennäköisyysluonne. Kvanttiluvut, Paulin kieltosääntö, spin ja jaksollinen järjestelmä. Kiinteän aineen rakenne, sidostyypit ja energiavyörakenne.
content.sv: Interferens, diffraktion, dispersion, grupp- och fashastighet. Heisenbergs osäkerhetsprincip, våg-partikeldualitet. Schrödingerekvationen, kvantmekanikens sannolikhetskaraktär. Kvanttalen, Pauliprincipen, spinn och periodiska systemet. Strukturen för fast materia, bindningar och energibandsstrukturen.
content.en: Interference, diffraction, dispersion, group- and phase velocity. Heisenberg's uncertainty principle, wave-particle dualism. Schrödinger's equation, statistical nature of quantum mechanics. Quantum numbers, Pauli exclusion principle, spin and periodic table of elements. Structure of solids, bond types and band structure.

Assessment methods: preliminary exercises, exercises, small group work, and seminar presentation as a part of the course.
